name: Digital Tinker (v1.4)
description: Slight tweak for tonight's small tournament - 3x Indexing, 1x Escher, 1x Tinkering, 2x Same Old Thing. It served me well, as I went 3-0 (6-0 overall) and won the tournament. I'm now 9-2 in tournament play with various versions of this deck.

name: Jinteki Brain Pie
description: Nothing really new here. But it's tested, this deck is a killer (fried three different players in three games). Usually you can keep your R&D without ICE. Flatline is around the corner. However, Indexing is the real enemy. Beware.

name: 硬件凯特
HB Single Core
Criminal Single Core
(Draft, Needs Help) Painting with Kit/YogSaurus
description:
Its my first attempt at making a Kit deck after playing mostly only CT so I went a little overboard ad the chance to be forced to use a bigger deck and dont know where to cut. Right now I have 3 MAJOR flaws in the deck as well.

The deck however is mostly focused on running R&D all the time and use paintbrush to make sure its free and easy to get in. and with 2 Mediums and a R&D Interface or 2 I can be cycling through the deck in no time to find your agendas.

The flaws in it however are: 1. The deck is above the card cap. This isnt so bad, just makes the deck inconsistent. 2. My rig REQUIRES me to have all my mem chips and Dino out to be fully effective. 3. Late game Econ... I just dont feel I have enough.

I would love all the comments and criticisms I can get as this is only my second deck I have built. I have 2 core sets and 1 of everything else to use in deck building. Thanks everyone.

name: GRNDL Cover Up Conspiracy
description: Bad publicity?! What bad publicity? What are you talking about? smile

name: Andromeda better
Greenhouse Effect 1.0
description:
Focused ICE melter deck.

Primary strategy: Remove ICE over R&D and Keyhole.

--Parasites: Tutor with Djinn, recur with Deja Vu and Clone Chip.

--Djinn can host Keyhole/Datasucker

--Wyrm/Datasucker/Surge make Parasite super-fast.

--You won't find Plascrete here. If you find yourself playing a deck like that you should try to race to keyhole and start trying to trash those cards if you can.

Formerly Reina ICE Melter

name: Painting with Kit
description: I had a dream after seeing Paintbrush and this is what has come from the dream. I decided to leave Plascrete out cause the meta a play in there is only one Weyland player other then me.

name: Graphic Design v1
description: Fairly standard stuff. Either your opponent spends time and money clearing tags or they open themselves up to you scoring via Psychos. You tend to have a decent bit of time to attempt scoring agendas as the runner has to steal at least 4 agendas to win, whereas you only need to score 1-3 yourself, depending on luck with Beales. Also Wraparound plus Power Shutdown to kill their Corroder is always a fantastic play, usually buying you at least one (if not more) turns.

name: Peddler Picasso, help me streamline this Paintbrush deck.
description: Pretty self-explanatory. Tinker unrezzed ICE and paint the rezzed ICE. Maybe drop Daily Casts due to having Omni-Drive and Lockpick money?

name: Huge rig kit.
description:
Deck built for a friend who is obsessed with rig building. Seems like you guys might like it. Check it out and let me know what you think.

Ignore no plascrete...For now we don't play weyland against him :)

name: Big Ice Can Work v2
Freelance Draw
Freelance Draw
Big Ice Can Work v2.1
HB-Rezurrect

name: NOICE 1.1
Starlight Theory
description: Made for the NYU Local Meta for the sole purpose of winning $5 from Frank Lantz.

name: Cyber Brush Rush (Mugging Lab Nerds) 2.0
description: took out modded for 2 tinkerings and got rid of escher (which I do not need) and on RD interface for 2 makers eye's.

name: Hacking in my Sleep (Shaper Double Deck)
description: Had to try for the whole Starlight + Power Nap interaction still in need of major testing.

name: Jinteki Tax Season
description: Tons of taxes on the runner so you can squeeze through Agendas. Still in early stage of testing.

name: 2014 Enchanted Realms S1 - 1st Place Corp
description: March 27th, 2014 - Mark C's corp deck from the Enchanted Realms' season one tournament. After four rounds of Swiss, Mark went 3-1 with this deck and finished in first place.

name: 2014 Enchanted Realms S1 - 1st Place Runner
description: March 27th, 2014 - Mark C's runner deck from the Enchanted Realms' season one tournament. After four rounds of Swiss, Mark went 3-1 with this deck and finished in first place.

name: Simpler Times CT
description:
• Get MO out asap.
  • Test Run + Scavenge or Scavenge to relocate Femmes
  • Mem chip in case of both femmes out.
  • Stimhack as a silver bullet or for using it with SMC.
  • Notoriety because scoring when YOU want it's always good!
  • All nighter in case of needing to Tinkering + Notoriety or IJ from heap + Notoriety or event a 2 turn Notoriety (edge case).
  • Vamp if hq is slightly defended, can recur with SOT :)
  • Just one indexing in case of needing a winning run,eventually can combo all nighter + notoriety for a big scoring turn.

That's basically it!

name: Greenhouse Effect v1.1.2 Beta
description:
Focused ICE melter deck.

Primary strategy: Remove ICE over R&D and Keyhole.

Parasite: Keep R&D clear; Wyrm/Datasucker make Parasite fast; Clone Chip for versatility

SMC: Tutor Keyhole; Tutor Breakers, Djinn

Djinn: Can host Keyhole/Datasucker/SMC; Tutor Crypsis/Parasite/Datasucker

No Plascrete. Use Keyhole to trash important kill cards.

//Formerly Reina ICE Melter

v1.1.2 Beta

++Added--Easy Mark x1 (Had 1 extra Inf); //Deck is now 46 cards

v1.1.1 Beta

Removed --Knight x3 (Too click intensive); Removed--Keyhole x1 (Need Keyhole in the Mid-late game, not early); //Deck now 45 cards

v1.1 Beta

Removed--Forged Activation Orders x2; Removed--Quality Time x1; Removed--Diesel x2; Added--Wyldside x3; Added--Aesops Pawnshop x2; Added--Self-Modifying Code x2; //Honorable Mention: Savoir-Faire (Replaced by SMC)

name: SUPER-EFFICIENCY v7
Kate deck rev. 3
description: experimental shaper deck build which i put together this morning... play tested it at my local gaming store with a skilled Netrunner player who was playing as Wayland... the deck i built did rather well in the games we played... i surprised myself with the strength of this build...

name: Have you seen Dinosaurus?
description:
Have you met... where is he? Have you seen Dinosaurus? I can't find him. He's about this tall, He's painted green, He likes to hold onto ICEbreakers for me. If you haven't seen him, I have to find him. Maybe one of the corps knows where he is. If they hurt him, I swear to glob... Well, I know they won't talk to me anymore, thanks to "The Incident"... Why would they put up so much ICE if they didn't want me to check it out?

Maybe Gabe will help me. He knows how to siphon accounts and make up activation orders, maybe he'll teach me. I'll get some Diesel on my way over in case I have to search all night. Oh, I can use that Toolbox I got last Chrimbus for the extra MU and recurring credits.

Don't worry, Dinosaurus, Detective Chippy is on the case!

name: Access Denied
description: My take on Nord's HB-Ash Deck.

name: Weyland Test
Weyland Test
Andy's Scapegoat (Stopping TWIY)
description: the idea of this deck is to do a lot of stuff that andy does well. PLUS have a source that doesn't leave play when they or you score, this deck has been quite effective at slowing down fast advance decks as I can have 4 sources in the game in addition to a lot of good andy stuff

name: Garden of the Ronin v1.2
description:
Viper in the grass
Flytrap nestles in the thorns
The Ronin's Garden

name: Activist Exile
Scorch 'em from Inside their Bedrooms
description:
The general idea behind this deck is to either win through advancing agendas (boring) or kill with a Invasion of Privacy/Scorched Earth combo. IoP is great as unpreventable (conditionally) damage. I thought about putting Snoop in so that the runner's hand is less of a secret, but it didn't make the final cut.

If any more experienced NBN players out there have any recommendations, I am all ears.
